meanings.definition: To jointly sponsor an event or project with another party.
meanings.sent1: Our school club decided to cosponsorship the charity fundraiser with the local community center.
meanings.sent2: The two companies agreed to cosponsorship the new product launch to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The penguin and the polar bear decided to cosponsorship the igloo-building contest for fun.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a cosponsorship, each supporting the other in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The cosponsorship between the two organizations made the event a huge success.

meanings.definition: The act of sharing sponsorship of an event or project with another party.
meanings.sent1: The cosponsorship of the concert helped bring in more attendees.
meanings.sent2: She thanked her colleague for the cosponsorship of the charity run.
meanings.sent3: The cosponsorship between the cat and the dog for the pet show was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The cosponsorship of the art exhibition was a beautiful collaboration of talents.
meanings.sent5: The cosponsorship agreement ensured both companies had equal involvement in the project.
